Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Eurocin (fungal defensins; natural AMPs; UCSS1a; 3S=S, fungii; BBW)

Literature Information.Literature: 183 bacterial strains were tested.Activity: Active against S. pneumonia ATCC49619 (MIC 0.25 ug/ml), S. pyogenes, S. agalactiae (MIC 0.06-1 ug/ml), S. aureus ATCC29213, E. faecium ATCC49624, S. epidermidis ATCC12228 (MIC 16 ug/ml), and E. faecalis ATCC29212 (2 ug/ml). Activity against Gram- bacteria not detected at 32 uM (MIC >32 ug/ml).Animal model:mouse:  When 10 mg/kg eurocin was administered, viable S. pneumoniae in the peritoneum of mice dropped by approximately 3 orders of magnitude after 2 h.  The polypeptide fod is similar to plectasin.Structure:You can rotate, zoom, and view the crystal structureherein the PDB.  Updated Jan2013; Jan2015.
Literature Information.Author: Oeemig JS, Lynggaard C, Knudsen DH, Hansen FT, Noergaard KD, Schneider T, Vad BS, Sandvang D, Nielsen LA, Neve S, Kristensen HH, Sahl HG, Otzen DE, Wimmer R.2012
Literature Information.Title: Eurocin, a new fungal defensin: structure, lipid binding and its mode of action.
